name: Proper Names That Can Be Used In Scrabble [2] Quiz | Hobbies | 10 Questions

questions.text:
This boy's name:
As a noun: a visible impression or trace on a surface.
As a verb: to make such an impression or trace.
questions.explanation:
mark.

	It can also mean a person as a target for some sort of crime. The proper name, Mark, sometimes a nickname of Marcus, is the name of the author of one the second Gospel in the New Testament.

questions.text: This girl's name is also the second letter in the Hebrew language:
questions.explanation:
beth.

	As a proper name, Beth is a common nickname for Elizabeth, which means 'God is my oath'.

questions.text:
This girl's name means:
as a verb: to institute legal proceedings.
questions.explanation:
sue.

	Sue, a nickname for Susan or Suzanne, which means 'lily' in Hebrew.

questions.text: This androgynous nickname means: to strike or tap lightly.
questions.explanation:
pat.

	"Saturday Night Live" had a famous skit called "It's Pat" (Pat was played by Julia Sweeney).  Pat was an androgynous character, who had the rest of the characters in the skits trying to figure out what gender he or she was.  Pat would start to give an answer, then say something that would leave the question still unanswered.

questions.text: This boy's name is a textile industry term for a specific length of a particular material, for example, 270 meters of linen, 770 meters of cotton or silk, or 840 yards of yarn.
questions.explanation:
hank.

	The name Hank is a form of the name Henry, which means "ruler of the home" (German).

questions.text: This boy's nickname is also a type of safety lamp.
questions.explanation:
davy.

	A nickname of David, which means "beloved" (Hebrew).

questions.text: This androgynous name also means "a broad valley".
questions.explanation:
dale.

	A glen is a narrow valley, not a broad one. Dale comes from German, meaning "valley".

questions.text: This boy's nickname can mean a small piece of a larger object, or breaking off a small piece from a large object.
questions.explanation:
chip.

	Chips is a diminutive form of Charles, which itself means "free man" (German). One of the world's most famous Chips is one of Walt Disney's cartoon squirrels, friend (and treemate) of Dale.

questions.text: This girl's nickname is also half of an alliterative name for a baked dessert made of apples or other fruit, bread crumbs, sugar, butter, and spice; it's called "brown ...".
questions.explanation:
betty.

	A brown betty is an American dessert made from fruit and sweetened crumbs that dates back to colonial times. The most familiar version is the apple brown betty, made with sliced apples and brown sugar. Berries are another popular ingredient of brown betties. Betty, as a name, is another popular nickname of Elizabeth.

questions.text: This girl's name is also the name of a spice made from the underground lower stem (mistakenly thought of as the root) of the plant Zingiber officinale.
questions.explanation:
Ginger.

	Ginger is a nickname of the girl's names Virginia, Ginerva, or Regina.
